text: Life is like riding a bicycle. To keep your balance you must keep moving
author: Albert Einstein (1879 – 1955), physicist who developed the general theory of relativity

text: It never gets easier, you just go faster
author: Greg LeMond, former pro rider, three times the Tour de France champion and twice Road Race world champion

text: Crashing is part of cycling as crying is part of love
author: Johan Museeuw, former pro rider, twice world champion

text: A bicycle ride around the world begins with a single pedal stroke
author: Scott Stoll, a Community Professor who travelled around the world on his bicycle

text: Cyclers see considerably more of this beautiful world than any other class of citizens. A good bicycle, well applied, will cure most ills this flesh is heir to
author: Dr. K. K. Doty

text: Like dogs, bicycles are social catalysts that attract a superior category of people.
author: Chip Brown, writer

text: Beyond pain there is a whole universe of more pain
author: Jens Voigt, former pro rider who holds the World Hour Record

text: Pain is temporary. It may last a minute, or an hour, or a day, or a year, but eventually it will subside and something else will take its place. If I quit, however, it lasts forever
author: Lance Armstrong, former pro rider who saw all his accomplishments going down the drain because of doping

text: When the spirits are low, when the day appears dark, when work becomes monotonous, when hope hardly seems worth having, just mount a bicycle and go out for a spin down the road, without thought on anything but the ride you are taking.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle (1859 – 1930), author of Sherlock Holmes

text: I have always struggled to achieve excellence. One thing that cycling has taught me is that if you can achieve something without a struggle it’s not going to be satisfying
author: Greg LeMond, former pro rider, three times the Tour de France champion and twice Road Race world champion

text: You never have the wind with you — either it is against you or you’re having a good day
author: Daniel Behrman (1924 – 1990), author of The Man Who Loved Bicycles

text: Cyclists live with pain. If you can’t handle it you will win nothing
author: Eddy Merckx, former pro rider super champion
